result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather L Calkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jackson County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Bond on file applied to the costs.
Obtain and maintain employment commensurate with her treatment needs.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by her agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by her agent.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, or by any other means, with:  Robert Wilkinson, Jason Brown, David Barhyte, Conner Hansen, Gage Lewallen or Amy Janicki.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

Credit for 73 days if revoked.

supervisions.notes: A civil judgment has been entered against you for the outstanding unpaid Court ordered financial obligations.

Stay any period of jail remaining if able to get into an in-patient treatment facility and arrangements have been confirmed with jail.  May be released for treatment directly to facility if reliable transport is confirmed with the jail.  Remaining jail is stayed if treatment is completed successfully.  Granted credit for 234 days served.

Concurrent with: Jackson County case 16CF26

records.addlTxt: Judgments entered in error.  No money due.  Jan Moennig, Clerk of Court.  11:38 am.
Payment Plan Request received.

ADDRESS INFO for Heather L Calkins
Current: 28254 County Hwy P, Kendall, WI 54638 United States  (Effective: 09-14-2017)
Prior: 1106 Cty Road J, Neillsville, WI 54456 United States

Defendant appears in person in custody with counsel Matt Prior in person.  DA Tavi McMahon appears specially for the State.  

16CF26 & 15CF101 - sentencing after revocation cases.  
Counsel have both reviewed the revocation packet and there are no corrections or additions noted.  DA McMahon recommends the Court adopt the DOC recommendations but with 9 months jail with jail credit on both cases which would result in time served on both cases.  Defense makes his statement to the Court regarding defendant undergoing voluntary treatment.  Defense notifies of jail credit on 16CF26 - 234 days credit; 15CF101 - 234 days credit.  Defense has the same recommendation as the State for sentencing.  DA McMahon amends his recommendation that the 9 months jail with credit is only if there is a CHIPS case filed as the defendant is now pregnant.  Court makes statement to the parties regarding her concerns.  Defense and defendant both make statements.  

Court orders on 16CF26 - 12 mos. jail; 15CF101 - 12 months jail concurrent.  Stay any period of jail remaining if able to go to an in-patient treatment facility and arrangements have been confirmed with jail.  May be released for treatment directly to facility if reliable transport is confirmed with the jail.  Credit granted on 16CF26 of 213 days ; and jail credit on 15CF101 of 234 days.  Remaining jail is stayed if successfully completed treatment.  Off record - Judge ordered judgments for the unpaid financial obligations.
sent ROAW to Judge this date.  JMM
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 5, 2017 at 09:00 am.

of 5/9 plea/sentencing hearing notice.
DNA submission form

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Huff.    Court questioned defendant on her understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing.  She stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived her right to have a preliminary hearing.

Defendant plead guilty to Count 1 in 15CF101  Defendant plead guilty to Count 2 in 16CF26.  Remaining counts in those cases, plus 15CF120 and 15CF212 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties of the charge she plead to.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. Felony warnings given.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently entered her plea and waived her constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of:  Possession of Meth, contrary to 961.41(3g)(g) and Felony Bail Jumping contrary to 946.49(1)(b).  Joint recommendation for:  probation 4 years.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  No contact with Robert Wilkinson,  Jason Brown,  David Barhyte,  or Conner Hansen.  AODA and recommended treatment.  90 days jail, stay all but first 21 days.  73 days credit.  Obtain maintain and maintain employment.  DNA sample.  Comply with trauma care.  

Court ordered: sentence withheld, probation 4 years, concurrent.   The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  No contact with Robert Wilkinson,  Jason Brown,  David Barhyte,  Conner Hansen, Gage Lewallen or Amy Janicki.    AODA and recommended treatment.  Subject to random drug testing.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  16CF26: 90 days jail, stay all but first 21 days on the condition that the defendant enters into inpatient treatment.  73 days credit if revoked.  Commensurate with treatment needs:  obtain maintain and maintain employment.  Submit DNA sample.  CC.
